chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
n: nat

Goal:
nat

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.lnot = fun a n : nat => Nat.lxor a (Nat.ones n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lnot (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.clearbit = fun a n : nat => Nat.ldiff a (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.clearbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.land (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise xorb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
in_int = fun p q r : nat => p <= r < q : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments in_int (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.double = fun n : nat => n + n : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.double _%nat_scope
compose1_3IsPR : forall f1 : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f1 -> forall f2 : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f2 -> forall f3 : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f3 -> forall g : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 g -> isPR 1 (fun x : nat => g (f1 x) (f2 x) (f3 x))
Nat.ones = fun n : nat => Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.ones _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.ldiff = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise (fun b0 b' : bool => b0 && negb b') a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.ldiff (_ _)%nat_scope
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.tail_addmul = fix tail_addmul (r n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => r | S n0 => tail_addmul (Init.Nat.tail_add m r) n0 m end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.tail_addmul (_ _ _)%nat_scope
compose1_2IsPR : forall f : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f -> forall f' : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f' -> forall g : nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 2 g -> isPR 1 (fun x : nat => g (f x) (f' x))
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.shiftl = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Init.Nat.double) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Init.Nat.shiftl (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.shiftr = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Init.Nat.div2) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Init.Nat.shiftr (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.tail_add = fix tail_add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n0 => tail_add n0 (S m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.tail_add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.eq = eq : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.eq (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t ?n) -> Fin.t (p + ?m) -> Fin.t (p + ?n) where ?m : [n : nat m : nat |- nat] ?n : [n : nat m : nat |- nat]
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2_up _%nat_scope
ltBool = fun a b : nat => let s := le_lt_dec b a in if s then false else true : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments ltBool (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.odd _%nat_scope
naryFunc = fix naryFunc (n : nat) : Set := match n with | 0 => nat | S n0 => nat -> naryFunc n0 end : nat -> Set Arguments naryFunc _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat := match n with | S (S n') => S (div2 n') | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.min = fix min (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => match m with | 0 => 0 | S m' => S (min n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.min (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
VectorDef.caseS' : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n)) (P : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n) -> Type), (forall (h : ?A) (t : VectorDef.t ?A ?n), P (VectorDef.cons ?A h ?n t)) -> P v where ?A : [n : nat m : nat |- Type] ?n : [n : nat m : nat |- nat]
Nat.Even = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Even _%nat_scope
boundedSearch = fun (P : naryRel 2) (b : nat) => boundedSearchHelp (P b) b : naryRel 2 -> nat -> nat Arguments boundedSearch _ _%nat_scope
